attributes.action: Create a DVLA licence category for electric scooters
attributes.additional_details: At present, privately owned e-scooters are technically illegal to use on public roads, pavements, and cycle lanes, despite their popularity and widespread use. This legal uncertainty means riders face fines and seizure, while the UK misses out on the benefits of a low-emission, low-cost, accessible transport option.
attributes.background: We ask the Government to create a dedicated DVLA vehicle category for electric scooters (e-scooter-like vehicles) so that they can be safely used on UK roads and cycle lanes.

rejection.details:
The following petition calls for a similar action: 

Require licenses to use an electric bike or electric scooter
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/706750
